preqs: 2012 pre-reqs: MED4071, MED4082 and MED40002014 pre-reqs: MED4171, MED4182, MED4200 and MED4000 or GMC4151, GMC4162, GMC4200 and GMC4000.

rules.ruleString: Any 3 (I/W) co-req units in {MED5091, MED5092, MED5100}
Must be enrolled in course version {4531, 4532, 4533, M6011, M6018, M6019}

(Must have passed 3 (I/W) units in {MED4000, MED4190, MED4200} or  Must have passed 4 (I/W) units in {MED4000, MED4171, MED4182, MED4200} or  Must have passed 4 (I/W) units in {GMC4000, GMC4151, GMC4162, GMC4200})

unitName: Contemporary developments in clinical practice: Patient safety
description: Medical practitioners are frequently required to respond to emerging and consolidating innovations and policies related to clinical practice. MED5102 further develops the concept of 'readiness to practice' and focuses upon the development of students' understanding of the principles of Patient Safety and the related clinical competencies. The unit will provide students with an understanding of the role of research in Patient Safety and the application of these principles and practices in diverse contexts. The unit will have the capacity to respond to other issues/innovations/policy changes as they arise in medical practice.
faculty: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences
